channel.title: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!
channel.description:
hey i came home today from school and i try to open WMP11 but it doesnt open up.. so ive practically tried everything to try to get it open. but still doesnt work ive looked in control panel to see if i could remove it from add or remove programs but it doesnt appear there. i also googled it to see if there is a way to delete it but ive found that once u install vista its like a built in program which cant be deleted..
so i was wondering if there is actually a way i could juss reinstall it and hopefully it starts to work again.. ive notice that u could delete like certain registry files and it would get deleted but im not sure if thats safe lol. or if i would b able to install it again after. im not sure why i cant even see it in add or remove programs tho
thanks for the help

item.title: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!

item.source: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!

item.title: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:10, topic:290169”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=383565.msg2880329#msg2880329 date=1248302031]

yeah i went to that site also… is it possible for me to like put in my vista cd and upgrade
because i read on another forum that this would reinstall or fix the wmp11 problem… but im not sure if all my data would get deleted when i upgrade ?

If you were to re-install vista you would have to format your harddrive, losing all you data if you don’t back it up. If you don’t know what your doing, don’t do it at all.
[/quote]

He said upgrade, not fresh install. Two completely different things. In an upgrade it doesn’t format your drive, it just adds the missing files, patches old files, etc.[/quote]

I know the difference I just missread it

Read full topic
item.source: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!

item.title: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:8, topic:290169”][quote author=darkilla link=topic=383565.msg2880323#msg2880323 date=1248301814]
yeah i went to that site also… is it possible for me to like put in my vista cd and upgrade
because i read on another forum that this would reinstall or fix the wmp11 problem… but im not sure if all my data would get deleted when i upgrade ?
[/quote]

If you were to re-install vista you would have to format your harddrive, losing all you data if you don’t back it up. If you don’t know what your doing, don’t do it at all.[/quote]

He said upgrade, not fresh install. Two completely different things. In an upgrade it doesn’t format your drive, it just adds the missing files, patches old files, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“darkilla, post:7, topic:290169”]yeah i went to that site also… is it possible for me to like put in my vista cd and upgrade
because i read on another forum that this would reinstall or fix the wmp11 problem… but im not sure if all my data would get deleted when i upgrade ?[/quote]

If you were to re-install vista you would have to format your harddrive, losing all you data if you don’t back it up. If you don’t know what your doing, don’t do it at all.

item.title: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

In my opinion:

Winamp = Music
VLC = Videos

Also:

darkilla:

but i still wondering how i could uninstall wmp11 atlleast off my computer ??

I googled around a bit, and it seems you can’t uninstall it from Vista only disable it.

Source: http://www.vistax64.com/vista-music-pictures-video/66513-uninstall-windows-media-player-11-vista.html

Read full topic

item.title: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!
item.dc:creator: @darkilla darkilla
item.description:
@darkilla wrote:

where can i find the wm11 installer i checkd on microsoft.com but said they only have it for Xp since vista already comes wit it once u install vista. and what restore point ? sorry im not that great with computer things like this…
and yes i have restarted same problem tho

Read full topic
item.source: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!

item.title: Windows Media Player 11 on Vista HELP!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Have you tried restarting your PC? Have you tried reverting to a restore point? Have you tried downloading the WM11 installer, and having it fix the installation? These are all things you should do before coming here for help.

Read full topic
